results.title: Understanding hearing loss
results.brief_description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be deaf? We can’t really reproduce that experience for hearing people, but here is a videotape that explains sound, hearing loss and the relationship between listening to speech and different kinds of hearing loss. Simulations of what speech sounds like with different kinds of hearing loss helps us to understand how much deaf people can get from listening and lipreading. Useful hints on how to communicate better with deaf people round off an informative introduction to hearing loss and its effect on learning and understanding.

results.title: Understanding government
results.creator_credit: Donald Dagett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: An introduction to government in Australia covering elections, the work of Parliament, the general organisation of the Public Service and the wide range of activities for which the government is responsible.

results.title: Understanding electronics: the transistor
results.creator_credit: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: In this film the early development of the transistor is traced, its natural superiority to the vacuum tube is made apparent, and its many modern applications are discussed.

results.title: Understanding discrimination
results.brief_description: Video based training program explains to employees what discrimination is, including direct and indirect discrimination. Also describes the steps an employee should take if they are being subjected to discriminatory behaviour. A manual complements the video and may be borowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Understanding cancer (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: By considering two basic questions, what is cancer? and what is the cause of cancer?, this program attempts to lay at rest many of the myths about this disease. A very comprehensive coverage of the nature of cancer, epidemiology and carcinogens. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, University of Sydney.

results.title: Understanding A.D.D.: Attention Deficit Disorder
results.creator_credit: Bryan Lowe and Australian Video Publishers
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It profiles the causes of ADD, behaviours associated with the condition, diagnosis, treatment, medication, adult manifestations of the condition and includes a segment with questions from the audience.

results.creator_credit: Eastman Teaching Films and Official Films

results.title: Underground water
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Forum Australia
results.brief_description: The importance of underground water in Australia. Indicates the extent to which the cattle country relies on bore water and the work being done by geologists and hydrographers in the field, and the scientists in laboratories, on the problem of desalination.
